name: Mercure Exeter Southgate Hotel

reviews.text: We had a 'Lovely' stay at The Southgate and have no complaints..its comfortable ..the food is good and the staff.."Lovely" which is the buzz word there..I know this is a boring review but what can one say..Oh yes..the bill which was as expected with the exception of a 30pound car parking fee..I pointed out that we had arrived by rail..and that for parking a large railway engine it was remarkably cheap..but as we had not..it was a trifle high..30 pounds too high in fact..the bill was amended with a smile and good grace ..Which was "Lovely"
reviews.title: 'Lovely'
Hotel ok but impersonal
reviews.text: First impression was that this hotel had been renovated but we were left disappointed at the impersonal and close to rude staff. Upon entering our room we were hit by extremely hot air. The air con wasn't working and was so noisy that we turned it off. When we rang to complain about the heat in the room we were advised that the bathroom towel heaters may cause the heat and were turned off at 9 pm but they cold provide us with a fan. We took the small desk fan and opened the window but had to put up with car park noises all night. The location is great and the bed was comfortable but when we checked out we didn't get a smile, or 'how was your stay?'nfrom the reception. Parking is 10 pound upon check out. Also absoultely no free wi fi - not sure this is a 4 star hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have found Mercure Hotels to be generally good, and this one was no exception. It is a smart building only 5 minutes away from the delightful area around the Cathedral. A large extension blends in well with the original buildings. Our room was modern and well equipped and well serviced, although it did not have the Espresso machine promised.and we would have preferred a bath to a shower. Car parking was maybe pricey, but ample and so convenient. We had dinner the first night and this was surprisingly good for what is essentially a commercial hotel. Set meal prices were good. Quality and imagination were pleasing. Breakfast was very good on our first morning there, a Friday. However on the Saturday we would have been caught in bid queues had we noat gone early. Food was OK, but demand meant that food ran out and tables were not cleared quickly. Sadly this is a common problem with commercial hotels at weekends although the hotel said they had at least two staff not turning in that morning. Overall very good and would certainly use again.
reviews.title: Good situation, good parking, good food but too busy for breakfast at weekends.

reviews.text: I personally like this hotel and the staff were lovely. It is well situated and very clean and stylish. Not luxury but very nice .I will stay here again, intact it is my second stay. Good car parking too.
reviews.title: Good accomodation in Exeter

reviews.text: What a lovely hotel right in the heart of Exeter the Cathedral City of Devonshire. Great accomodation and friendly staff.I would stay here again. It is in a central location for all amenities in the city and for the University.A good place to stay to visit other parts of Devon or on business.
reviews.title: What a lovely hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here on business on the recommendation of a colleague. I arrived very early and parked in their secure car park and went off to my meetings for the day. On checking in, reception was exceptionally efficient and welcoming - and I was given an upgrade to a suite! Things like that never happen to me!
reviews.title: Excellent - and an upgrade too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was great and had all the lovely little extra touches including complimentary soft drinks etc.The bathroom was immaculate - great big bath and fab walk in shower - fluffy robe and towels. Bed was incredibly comfy and my room was really quiet, with great views too.
reviews.title: Usual Mercure Standard

reviews.text: Breakfast was a buffet, but was good quality and very efficient.
reviews.title: Up to Mercure's usual high standards, but just a little souless

reviews.text: I used the express check out as there was a bit of a queue. My car parking had already been added to the bill and a card to get straight out of the car park was there too. My VAT invoice duely turned up the following day in the post as requested.
reviews.title: A bit of a shambles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitely stay here again, and hopefully make use of the leisure facilities too!
reviews.title: A treat for our wedding night

reviews.text: I stayed for one night on business and was impressed with all aspects of the hotel including the room, the gym and the breakfast. The bed has to be one of the comfiest I have ever slept in; complimentary Wi-Fi for business guests is a welcome touch as was the chilled soft drinks in the room.
reviews.title: Great hotel and a brilliant night sleep!

reviews.text: The bar has a good atmosphere and the food at breakfast was a high standard.
reviews.title: Peaceful and great location

reviews.text: I would recommend and will be back!
reviews.title: Short break only one hour from home

reviews.text: Stayed one night in mid-September. Hotel was ok, but had the feel of any city centre hotel. The room could have been in any hotel around the world, but was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Good location but a bit corporate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel seems to have a lot of weddings on, which makes ordering drinks at the bar a bit of a lottery, but we didn't suffer a poor night's sleep as a result of any noise, etc.
reviews.title: West Country

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is the main thing that makes this hotel worth staying in. The dinner we had was also pretty decent.
reviews.title: Food to die for

reviews.text: Downsides - I was asked to pay £4 per hour for the internet (surely this must be wrong - it was cheaper in Tokyo), plus they managed to produce a completely tasteless cooked breakfast, which is no mean feat.
reviews.title: My last accor visit as an A Club member was an upgrade, this time was a downgraded, won't touch this shower ever again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location and room. The staff were all excellent and very helpful.Breakfast was also very good.
reviews.title: Very good hotel but could be better on customer care given its 4* rating.

description: 4 star city centre hotel which is a great base for exploring the devon coast & dartmoor.
